prop_obj.text: The syllabus is intended to provide candidates with the opportunity to demonstrate the extent of their
aesthetic awareness, emotional and visual development through perceptual and creative activities.

items.text: The syllabus is intended to provide candidates with the opportunity to demonstrate the extent of their aesthetic awareness, emotional and visual development through perceptual and creative activities.

dataList.data: The syllabus is intended to provide candidates with the opportunity to demonstrate the extent of their

prop_obj.text: The syllabus is intended to provide candidates with the opportunity to demonstrate the extent of their

dataList.data: aesthetic awareness, emotional and visual development through perceptual and creative activities.

prop_obj.text: aesthetic awareness, emotional and visual development through perceptual and creative activities.
Candidates should be able to respond to questions which seek to evaluate their:
(i)  Development of perceptual, analytical and expressive skills through a variety of art activities
(ii)  Knowledge and skills in the use and maintenance of art tools, equipment and materials.
(iii)  Level of appreciation of values and qualities of different works of art.
Knowledge and application of design elements and principles.
(v)  Knowledge of art history and art structure.
Knowledge and appreciation of their culture in relation to other cultures.
Understanding of the meaning, significance and role of art in the socio-economic
Understanding indigenous art technology, aesthetics, beliefs, values and attitudes.
(ix)  Skills in the development of local materials and resources especially in the promotion of

prop_obj.text: There will be three papers, Papers 1, 2 and 3 all of which must be taken.  Papers 1 and 2 will be a
composite paper to be taken at one sitting.
PAPER 1: Will consist of forty multiple-choice objective questions all of which must be
PAEPR 2: Will consist of five essay-type questions. Candidates will be required to
answer three questions within 1 hour 30 minutes for 60 marks.
PAPER 3: Will consist of two sections, Sections A and B.
Section A will be drawing/painting and will be compulsory for all candidates.
Two questions will be set, one on still life and the other on imaginative   composition and
candidates will be expected to answer one of them within 3  hours for 50 marks.
Section B will consist of two questions, one on lettering/calligraphy and the other onproduct
design.  Candidates will be required to answer one question from
product design within 3 hours for 50 marks.
The paper will be sent to candidates a fortnight in advance of the date of its

prop_obj.text: Concept of Visual Arts and General Knowledge in Art.
Scope and Vocations of Visual arts.
The Role of Art in National Development.
Definition, techniques, types and purposes of drawing and identification.
Exploration of tools, equipment and materials used in art.
iii. Preparation, uses, care and maintenance of drawing media.
Idea development from natural and man-made objects.
iii. Drawing for communication; analytical study – object and figure drawing.
vi. Two and three dimensional drawing/designing.
vii. Computer as a tool in art (identification of parts and uses).
ix. Elements, principles and organization of design.
xi. Colour (definition), the twelve-point colour wheel, sources of colour,
colour terminologies, colour mixing (tints and shades/gradation), colour
harmony, colour philosophy, colour psychology, colour relationships, colour
xii. Ghanaian colour concepts e.g. association of colour with objects.
Identification of tools, materials and equipment.
iii. The basic printing processes – direct and indirect e.g., relief printing, intaglio, lithography,
serigraphy and photographic screen printing etc.  Print from
iv.   Printing as a means of
Types of lettering e.g. block lettering- construction of block letters,
calligraphy, upper and lower case letters, parts of letters etc.
Beginnings, location of art and development through the ages e.g.
Use of prehistoric art in promoting aspects of living. E.g. hunting
iii. Creative desires of the caveman (reasons and purposes of hunting).
iv. Techniques, tools and materials used by the caveman
Characteristics and conventions or canons of art.
iii. Relevance and influence of Egyptian art on other cultures.
Greek art – contributions to the development of art during the
Renaissance art – (meaning, period of rebirth) origin etc.
iii. Major contributions: artists of the period and achievements
Relevance of renaissance art to mankind.
vi. Oriental art – beliefs, art forms, functions and influences on the
following; Indian art, Chinese art and Japanese art.
vii. Oceanic art – beliefs, art forms and functions of Polynesian art and
Influence of religious beliefs – animism, magic, myth,
Types of art forms and functions.
iii. Concept of art in Africa (functionality).
iv. Types – visual, performing and verbal.
Main characteristics of indigenous African art forms.
vi. Arts of the major ethnic groups of West Africa.
vii. Types of contemporary arts i.e. visual, performing and
ix. Uses and relevance of indigenous and
Religion, education, trade and politics as agents of change
Indigenous art forms and artists – identification of
Ghanaian art forms e.g. Adinkra etc.
Contemporary/current Ghanaian Art forms and artists.
iii. Form, symbolism and functions of Ghanaian arts.
iv. Art and Tourism: Roles and contributions of art in the
Procedures in art appreciation – identification, inventory,
iii. Creativity – definition and relevance, the creative process,
iv. Aesthetics, criticism and judgement – definitions and
Modern art – philosophy, style, artists and impact.
Setting up an enterprise – factors to consider e.g. where to get financial and
iii. Managing an enterprise – functions of a manager, the importance of good
customer relations, costing and pricing etc.
iv. Costing and pricing – factors to consider.
vi     Business risks - direct and indirect risks.
to consider in planning, preparing and

data.preamble: PAPER 3: Will consist of two sections, Sections A and B.

dataList.data: PAPER 3: Will consist of two sections, Sections A and B.

prop_obj.text: PAPER 3: Will consist of two sections, Sections A and B.

items.text: Section A will be drawing/painting and will be compulsory for all candidates.

dataList.data: Section A will be drawing/painting and will be compulsory for all candidates.

prop_obj.text: Section A will be drawing/painting and will be compulsory for all candidates.

items.text: Two questions will be set, one on still life and the other on imaginative   composition and candidates will be expected to answer one of them within 3  hours for 50 marks.

items.text: Section B will consist of two questions, one on lettering/calligraphy and the other onproduct design.  Candidates will be required to answer one question from either lettering/calligraphy or product design within 3 hours for 50 marks.
